definition: spark/meteor trail (mostly used in expressions like 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3])
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
see 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3]

sentences.english: State department rimmon, eager to spark.
This item listed in the China Spark Program in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 該項目2004年列入國家星火計劃。

sentences.english: You might also consider a spark arrestor for the front of the fire bowl , too .
sentences.chinese: 您也可以考慮星火避雷器，爲前線的消防碗，太。

sentences.english: At present investment-security-fund industry is in rapid development stage.
sentences.chinese: 目前證券投資基金業正以星火燎原之勢蓬勃發展。

sentences.english: Theimages from Starfire are 40 times sharper than uncorrected pics.
sentences.chinese: 從星火的圖像40倍裸照片清晰。

sentences.english: A single spark can start a prairie fire, where smoking is prohibited.
sentences.chinese: 星火可以燎原，此處嚴禁吸菸。

sentences.english: Medical aid must be sent to the stricken area posthaste.
sentences.chinese: 災區需用醫藥，急如星火。

sentences.english: Efforts to make "Star" products to "Spark" program peak.
sentences.chinese: 努力使“星河”產品達到“星火”計劃頂峯。

sentences.english: The fireman: Never has a spark been allowed to exist to develop into a conflagration.
sentences.chinese: 火警說“永遠不會讓點點星火演變成大火災”。

sentences.english: Stellar Cinema is located at No. 1, West Zhijiang…
sentences.chinese: 星火電影院坐落在芷江西路1號。

sentences.english: You leave your memory as a flame to my lonely lamp of separation.
sentences.chinese: 你將回憶視爲點點星火留在我離別的孤燈中。

sentences.english: Makes anger anti-it in the spark, will stop wants the water against to be dreadfull.
sentences.chinese: 制怒火阻其於星火，遏欲水防之將滔天。

sentences.english: This program has completed by the favor of The Spark Program of Fujian.
sentences.chinese: 本項目是在福建省星火計劃項目資助下完成的。

sentences.english: Stellar Cinema is located at No. 1, West Zhijiang Road.
sentences.chinese: 星火電影院坐落在芷江西路1號。

definition: a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
